Description: Omphalos of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (worn in places); rosette of alternate added red and white petals on top of omphalos; red and white bands around omphalos and on bowl; part of white billet pattern or tongues on bowl; exterior: band of single dots between pairs of lines on wall flanking omphalos.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, possibly no. 1214) (Number not precised)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1996) (phase 2)
